attributes.action: Make it law to stop and report hitting a cat with your vehicle
attributes.additional_details: The law states that road accidents involving specific animals e. g dogs, horses, cattle etc. require the driver to stop and report the incident, but cats are not mentioned. This has been law for nearly 40 years and 29% of households have at least 1 cat. That means nearly 20 million people keep a cat as a pet, yet there is still no law to protect them if there is a road accident involving them
attributes.background: change the Road Traffic Act of 1988 to require a person to stop and report whenever they hit a cat with their vehicle. Cats are as much a pet as a dog, and for 37 years now it has been law to do so for dogs, so why not cats?

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/728011
